title: Why are patients exiting substance misuse treatment and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
There are many different reasons why an individual may exit treatment. Of those adults in treatment, the proportion who exited treatment in each year free of dependence increased from 43% in 2009/10 to 53% in 2011/12, where it remained stable. The difference in successful completion across user groups can be seen in more detail in the chart below.

The proportion of those in treatment who dropped out or left, decreased from 30% in 2009/10 to 25% in 2011/12, but increased back to 27% in the two years to 2014/15. 15% of users were transferred out of their current care structure to receive further care in the community or prison. The number of users declining treatment fell from 4% in 2009/10to 2% in 2014/15.
data_source: Public Health England, National Drug Treatment Monitoring System
